'''Quilava''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''マグマラシ''' ''Magmarashi'') is a {{type|Fire}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation II]].

It [[Evolution|evolves]] from {{p|Cyndaquil}} starting at level 14 and evolves into {{p|Typhlosion}} starting at level 36.

==Biology==
Quilava is a slim quadruped Pokémon. The top half of its body is blue, while the lower half is cream. Its ears are triangular with red insides, and it possesses a rounded nose and red eyes. It has five red spots on its body that can project flames: two in a somewhat exclamation-mark shape on its forehead and three lined up horizontally on its rear. The fire coming from its head and rear can be launched as a flame attack. It also uses gusts of superheated air as a battle technique. Quilava's fur is non-flammable, so it can withstand flame attacks. Quilava tends to be rare in the wild, but can sometimes be found living on {{DL|List of Pokémon by habitat|Grassland Pokémon|grasslands}}.

==In the anime==
[[File:Dawn Quilava.png|255px|thumb|right|Quilava in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
===Major appearances===
====[[Ash's Quilava]]====
Ash's {{p|Cyndaquil}} evolved into Quilava in ''[[DP182|An Old Family Blend!]]'', fighting one of [[Team Rocket's mechas]]. He used it during his battle with [[Nando]] at the [[Lily of the Valley Conference]], where it battled against Nando's {{p|Armaldo}}; the battle resulted in a tie.

====[[Jimmy's Quilava]]====
Quilava is {{jo|Jimmy}}'s [[starter Pokémon]] that he received from [[Professor Elm]]. It evolved prior to ''[[The Legend of Thunder!]]''.

====[[Dawn's Quilava]]====
Dawn's {{p|Cyndaquil}} evolved into Quilava in [[SS024]] in order to fight off a swarm of {{p|Ariados}}. She used it during a battle with Ash in ''[[BW093|Goodbye Junior Cup - Hello Adventure!]]'' against [[Ash's Pikachu]] but the battle was called off without a winner.

====Other====
Quilava debuted in ''[[EP262|You're A Star, Larvitar]]'', where {{Ash}} witnessed a Trainer training with his Quilava for the [[Silver Conference]]. He also considered for a short time of getting his Cyndaquil to evolve as a way of training it for the Silver Conference, following Cyndaquil's defeat against [[Satchel]]'s {{p|Magby}}.

A Quilava appeared in ''[[EP267|Love, Pokémon Style!]]'' as [[Macy]]'s Pokémon. She used it against Ash during the Silver Conference, but it was defeated by his {{AP|Squirtle}}. Later, in ''[[EP268|Tie One On!]]'', she used it in her battle against [[Vincent|Jackson]], where it battled his {{p|Poliwhirl}} and won.

In ''[[AG128|Shocks and Bonds]]'', [[Clark]], a Trainer that likes to conduct battles like a symphony, used a Quilava and {{p|Charizard}} against [[Ash's Grovyle]] and {{AP|Glalie}}. Despite the type disadvantage, Ash's Grovyle defeated Clark's Quilava.

A Quilava was used by one of two [[Ryan and Bryan|twin brothers]] in ''[[DP029|The Champ Twins!]]'' in a battle against Ash and {{an|Dawn}}. The other twin used {{p|Croconaw}}. The twins were able to defeat [[Ash's Turtwig]] and [[Dawn's Piplup]] due to a lack of teamwork but were defeated in the rematch.

===Minor appearances===
A Quilava appeared in ''[[AG122|Deceit and Assist]]'', under the ownership of a [[Pokémon Coordinator]] participating in the [[Hoenn Grand Festival]].

A Quilava appeared in ''[[DP010|Not on MY Watch Ya Don't!]]''.

Two {{pkmn|Trainer}}s' Quilava appeared in ''[[SM034|A Crowning Moment of Truth!]]''.

===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
{{main|Exbo}}
{{adv|Gold}}'s [[Exbo|Cyndaquil]]  evolved into Quilava during a training session at the [[Pokémon Day Care|Day Care Center]] outside of [[Goldenrod City]] in ''[[PS108|Quilava Quandary]]''. He became more powerful than he was in his previous form, and defeated many of the Johto {{tc|Team Rocket Grunt}}s' Pokémon for Gold.

In {{PAV|9}} the former illustrator [[Mato]], used a Quilava as a self-portrait.

==Trivia==
* Quilava shares its {{pkmn|category}} with {{p|Typhlosion}} and {{p|Entei}}. They are all known as the Volcano Pokémon.
** Coincidentally, they all learn {{m|Eruption}}.

===Origin===
Its appearance is similar to most animals in the {{wp|weasel}} family, resembling {{wp|stoat}}s in particular based on its lack of a tail and the fur on its upper body being significantly darker than that on its underbelly. Its appearance is also quite close to a {{wp|paca}}, a South American rodent with a slender body, spotted skin and tiny ears.

====Name origin====
Quilava is a combination of ''quill'' (a needle-like hair) and ''lava'' (extrusive molten rock).

Magmarashi is a combination of ''magma'' and 山荒 ''yama-arashi'' ({{wp|porcupine}}).
